clinical_study.brief_title: Juvenile Essential Arterial Hypertension and Vascular Function
clinical_study.official_title: Juvenile Essential Arterial Hypertension and Vascular Reactivity in Systemic and Cerebral Circulation

lead_sponsor.agency: Josip Juraj Strossmayer University of Osijek

clinical_study.source: Josip Juraj Strossmayer University of Osijek

brief_summary.textblock: The main goal of this study is to investigate the association of the juvenile essential arterial hypertension with systemic micro- and macrovascular reactivity and cerebral vascular function, and to examine the potential impact of elevated oxidative stress on this associations.

primary_outcome.description: Skin microvascular reactivity assessed by Laser Doppler flowmetry (post-occlusive reactive hyperemia, iontophoresis of acetylcholine and sodium nitroprusside) - measured in perfusion units (PU)
Vascular ultrasound measurement of brachial artery response to vascular occlusion (flow mediated dilation; FMD, %)
Cerebral blood flow velocities assessed by transcranial Doppler sonography (cm/s)

secondary_outcome.measure: Oxidative stress - thiobarbituric acid reactive substances (TBARS)
secondary_outcome.description: Serum sample collection for measurement of biomarkers of oxidative stress level. Thiobarbituric acid reactive substances (TBARS) - biomarker of lipid peroxidation.
Serum sample collection for ELISA measurement of serum endocan level - proteoglycan associated with endothelium activation

other_outcome.description: Automatic oscillometric measurement of blood pressure (in mmHg)
Automatic oscillometric measurement of heart rate (bpm)
Measurement of body weight (kg) and body height (cm) from which will be combined to report body mass index (BMI) using formula: weight (kg) / [height (m)]2 (kg/m2)

other_outcome.measure: Body composition - Fat Free Mass estimation
other_outcome.description: Body composition status measured by a fourterminal portable impedance analyzer. Based on the value of skin resistance (Ohm) empirically dervide formulas (the original manufacturer's software) will be used to calculate the estimated Fat Free Mass (FFM kg)

Body composition status measured by a fourterminal portable impedance analyzer. Based on the value of skin resistance (Ohm) empirically dervide formulas (the original manufacturer's software) will be used to calculate the estimated Fat (Fat Mass kg)

Body fluid status measurement by a four-terminal portable impedance analyzer. Based on the value of skin resistance (Ohm) empirically derived formulas (the original manufacturer's software) will be used to calculate the estimated Total Body Water (TBW L), Extracellular Water (ECW L), Intracellular Water (ICW L), Plasma Fluid (PF L) and Interstitial Fluid (IF L).

study_pop.textblock: children aged 9-18 years of both sexes; normotensive and children with essential arterial hypertension

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy normotensive children and children with essential arterial hypertension
Exclusion Criteria:
- secondary arterial hypertension
- other systemic diseases with immunopathology
- neurodegenerative diseasesat
- children that use therapy which has a high impact on vascular or immunological function (immunotherapy, immunosuppressive therapy, sistemic corticosteroid therapy etc..).
